transcripts.text: Let's play this clip of Derek Evans, a member of the West Virginia House of Delegates, getting arrested for his actions on Capitol Hill.  And I'll tell you something.  I'll tell you the political relevance of this, right, is, again, it's going to be very hard for Joe Manchin to have this – subtextual threat of jumping to the republican party.  the more this stuff gets to play because like this clip right here watching this guy go to jail the net effect of this is it tarnishes the brand of the republican party ever so slightly.  there's got to be more of this.  Anything you want to say on his behalf?  He's a fine man.
And thank you Mr.  Trump for invoking a riot at the White House.
And you're his grandmother?  I'm his grandmother.  Wow.  Wow.  Wow.  That's something.  That is something.  That is not exactly what I expected her to say.
Thank you, Mr.  Trump, for inciting a riot.
Yeah, I am.  That is not what I anticipated she would be saying.
If he becomes massively unpopular for the rest of his life, it would be very funny.  I'm hoping that sort of attitude takes off.

You think she's being sarcastic, right?  No.  No?  Oh, no.  Oh, wait.  She was being sarcastic.  Yeah.  Oh, did you expect somebody to come out of that house and blame Donald Trump for that?  I did not.
Oh, I did not.  Not at all.  And if that is indicative of the way that a lot of these people are reacting, what that does is it disempowers Josh Hawley.  It disempowers Ted Cruz.  I mean, it is.
I did not sense the sarcasm there.  I'm really sorry.
No, you did.  You did sense the sarcasm.  She wasn't.
No, I didn't.  I thought that she was being serious at first.
Oh, no, no, no, no.  I think she was basically saying like, this is Donald Trump's fault.  Thanks a lot, asshole.  He's a good man.  Thanks a lot.
